channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: MIT vision system teaches robots to understand their bodies
item.description: MIT CSAIL researchers said Neural Jacobian Fields can learn to control any robot from a single camera, without any other sensors. The post MIT vision ...

item.title: New AI architecture delivers 100x faster reasoning than LLMs with just 1,000 training examples
item.description: Hierarchical Reasoning Models (HRM) tackle complex reasoning tasks while being smaller, faster, and more data-efficient than large AI models.

item.title: This popular market index hit its peak four years ago. What this means for stocks.
item.description: How worrisome is the performance gap between the S&P 500 and the Russell 2000?

item.title: He’s seen enough bull markets to be worried now. But this veteran investor still likes these stocks.
item.description: RIA Advisor’s Lance Roberts says Trump’s trade policies could trigger a correction soon.

item.title: ‘Poof! His money could disappear’: My boyfriend is 75. His portfolio is down 4% this year. Do we fire his adviser?
item.description: “His portfolio is still down from the April slump when everybody else’s accounts have gone up.”

item.title: Is this a good time to invest in the S&P 500? I’m 66, retired and have $700K.
item.description: “I own my home outright. I also get Social Security, but not much.”

item.title: ‘I’m considering giving up my U.S. citizenship’: I’m 39 and moving to the U.K. How should I invest my $30K savings?
item.description: “My credit cards are paid off monthly, but I finally paid off my student loans earlier this year.”

item.title: Why AI is making us lose our minds (and not in the way you’d think)
item.description: The question isn’t, “will you use AI?” The question is, “what kind of AI user do you want to be: driver or passenger?”
